comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: That's Mrs. Charles Dana Gibson, the former Irene Langhorn (d. 1956), and Mrs. Borden Harriman, the former Florence Jaffray (1870-1967), leader of the Women's Fusion League. They were campaigning together for Mayor Mitchel in October 1913. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florence_Jaffray_Harriman Both women are in earlier images in LOC uploads to Flickr Commons.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of Mrs. Charles Dana Gibson (whose husband was a famous artist, who drew the "Gibson Girl") campaining for the Fusion Ticket of New York City Mayoral candidate John Purroy Mitchel, who was victorious in the November election (Bain mistakenly identifies Mrs. Gibson as Mrs. Harriman):
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4464310709/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Wystan: The photo you've posted is incorrectly captioned.  You'll notice in the original photograph, the woman on the left is identified as Mrs. J. B. Harriman.  This is the woman identified as Mrs. C. Gibson, with a question mark.  And, I am uncertain about her identity as well.   Pennylrichardsca:  I wonder if you will note the number of an image from a previous upload in which Mrs. Charles Dana Gibson is identified from this time period.  Thanks.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Sure--here's another photo labeled as featuring Mrs. Charles Dana Gibson: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163902620/ and another: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4445869566/

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: OK, Thanks pennylrichardsca, I finally found an article confirming her as a part of this movement. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B0CEED6163DE633A... I wasn't sure it was the same woman, as in the other photographs we have of her, she appears more as a socialite. We'll fill in the title information to as many records as we are able to.

comment._content:
